intro: Rauvolfia linearisepala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rosenroot, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Africa. It features slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Botanically, it belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics.
